transcript: round the table in a merry mood, sitting down now by one, now by another, of the guests. To each of them he made some careless and agreeable remark except to Pierre and He*I- ne, whose presence he seemed not to notice. He enlivened the whole party. The wax can- dles burned brightly, the silver and crystal gleamed, so did the ladies' toilets and the gold and silver of the men's epaulets; servants in scar- let liveries moved round the table, and the clat- ter of plates, knives, and glasses mingl
